result.pre: The common tick,
result.post: (L.) (Acari: Ixodidae), is a triphasic tick that parasitizes a large number of vertebrates includi
result.name: binomial

result.pre: , medium to large mammals; birds and lizards (Becker et al. 2009). The abundance of
result.post: on different vegetation types in a wooded area of Southern Italy was determined by Dantas-Torres a
result.name: binomial

result.pre: s determined by Dantas-Torres and Otranto ( 2013). They found that the abundance of
result.post: larvae on the ground-level vegetation was generally higher than on the higher vegetation whereas b
result.name: binomial

result.pre: eas both nymphs and adult stages were more abundant on higher vegetation. The questing behavior of
result.post: consists of climbing the low vegetation to a point from where it can attach to the passing hosts.
result.name: binomial
